other_tests.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left. No pericardial effusion. The mildly distended gallbladder contains multiple dependent gallstones. The common bile duct appears patent without obstructing calculi. No pericholecystic fluid or enhancement. There is a 6.1 cm x 4.0 cm ovoid lesion directly adjacent to the lesser curvature of the stomach, potentially reflecting a gastrointestinal stromal tumor. 6 mm short axis lymph node adjacent to the gallbladder, likely reactive.
